H0.text: who was the first person to successfully introduce a device exclusively designed for data processing. Charles Babbage

H1.text: who was the first person to successfully introduce a device exclusively designed for data processing. Ada Lovelace

H2.text: who was the first person to successfully introduce a device exclusively designed for data processing. Alan Turing

H3.text: who was the first person to successfully introduce a device exclusively designed for data processing. Herman Hollerith

A4.text: He invented the first automatic card-feed mechanism and the first keypunch.

A5.text: His invention of the punched card tabulating machine, patented in 1884, marks the beginning of the era of mechanized binary code and semiautomatic data processing systems.
